overview: From 2025-10-01 to 2025-10-02, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 9 new PRs (6 merged), 8 new issues, and 31 active contributors.

topIssues.title: op-node: split CLI/entrypoint/service/backend
topIssues.author: protolambda
topIssues.body:
Split the op-node setup to better encapsulate the separate layers of service framework:
- CLI: CLI definition, urfave etc.
- entrypoint: turns CLI into config, returns service as CLI lifetime
- service: manages peripherals (metrics, pprof, rpc servers), and inner backend
- backend: business logic of the actual node

topIssues.title: Refine alerts and runbooks for flashblocks
topIssues.author: yashvardhan-kukreja
topIssues.body: Revisit all the alerts related flashblocks and have runbooks ready for them backed by a good justification of the numbers/thresholds used in the alerts.

topIssues.title: op-node: cleanup error-handling in derivation
topIssues.author: protolambda
topIssues.body:
During the refactor of the derivation/driver code (See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/10599) @ajsutton identified that the error handling is difficult to follow / getting dropped silently in some cases.

Separate from the initial refactor work we can change it to more clearly branch/return, and handle all error cases (even if the errors are not critical, at least they can be logged).

See:
- errors returned by `TryBackupUnsafeReorg`
- errors returned by `TryUpdateEngine`
- the return-if-not-EOF (nil or non-EOF error) cases

topIssues.title: op-chain-ops: Fix source map lookups in SourceMapFS
topIssues.author: Inphi
topIssues.body: Source maps are either broken or no longer where we expect them to be since the latest solc/forge upgrade. Specifically, reading source maps from [`SourceMapFS`](https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/da85e698c4d6999c673e6e80233b08b217d62e2d/op-chain-ops/foundry/sourcefs.go#L129) always returns an error for valid forge artifacts.

topPRs.title: feat(op-acceptance-tests): introducing the flake-shaker
topPRs.author: scharissis
topPRs.body: ## Description Flake-shake is a test stability validation system that runs tests multiple times to detect flakiness before they reach production gates. It serves as a quarantine area where new or potentially unstable tests must prove their reliability. ## Testing Manually triggered workflow in CI. ([example](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/ethereum-optimism/optimism/102414/workflows/b8c928f3-cd9d-47f9-af36-dcc13477938d))

topPRs.title: opcm: Add unit tests around DevFeatures
topPRs.author: mbaxter
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Add unit tests around `DevFeatures.sol` and corresponding go code.

Modify logic to return false if a combined set of features is checked against a bitmap containing only a subset of those features.  For example, `DevFeatures.isDevFeatureEnabled(BITMAP_A, FEATURES_AB)` should return false. 

**Tests**

Add unit tests for DevFeatures.

**Metadata**

Relates to https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/issues/12421

topPRs.title: op-acceptance-tests: Cache and canonicalize L2EL payloads after gap fill
topPRs.author: pcw109550
topPRs.body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

Add a test that validates EL payload caching behavior at EL side after the initial EL Sync is completed, filling in the unsafe gaps.
